isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - ENGINE WARNING LIGHTS

svcprocinfo.para: Inspect engine warning light circuits and connectors as outlined in paragraph BEFORE TROUBLESHOOTING.

The yellow Check Engine Light (CEL) and the red Stop Engine Light (SEL) should come on for several seconds, then go out as part of the ECM start-up procedure. The lights should also be ON when certain faults are active. If either or both of these lights do not come ON during the key-ON start-up test, perform Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Do Not Operate test procedure.
If either or both of these lights stays ON and there are NO active fault codes logged, perform Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Stays ON test procedure.

svcsubproc.title: Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Do Not Operate

figure.caption: Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Do Not Operate

svcsubproc.title: Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Stays ON

figure.caption: Yellow Check Engine Light And/Or Red Stop Engine Light Stays ON
